microbeTest.targetPopulation: Patients that are positive for SARS-CoV-2 who are seeking variant information.

fdaReviews.reviewCategoryDesignation: IUO - Investigational Use Only. The performance characteristics of this product have not been established.

microbeTest.testDevelopment: Test developed by laboratory (no manufacturer test name)
microbeTest.howToOrder: If you would like to begin sending samples to the lab for COVID testing, please contact covid@lab_domain_name.com.
microbeTest.sampleRequirement: Please visit https://www.lab_domain_name.com/COVID-19/sample for comprehensive instructions for specimen collection and transport.

testServices.comment: Please indicate in the form that you are interested in this service.

testServices.otherService: Follow up in 2 months with antibody test

microbeTest.testingStrategy: Reflex test for Sars-CoV-2 positive specimens.
testContactPolicies: Laboratory can only accept contact from health care providers. Patients/families are encouraged to discuss testing options with their health care provider.
microbeTest.commentForTestPerformanceLocation: At facility on General Atomics Court.

methods.methodCategory: Sequence analysis of the entire coding region

platforms.otherPlatform: TaqMan Fast Virus 1-Step Master Mix (Applied Biosystems)

microbeTest.testProcedureOrProtocol: The procedure involves viral RNA extraction from the sample, reverse transcription, PCR, library preparation, NGS sequencing, analysis, and report generation.  Real-time multiplex PCR aids in identification of viral variants.
microbeTest.testResultsConfirmation: Dual methodologies for this test aid in confirmation of test results
microbeTest.testComment: This test is highly reproducible with low variability over different specimen sources.
microbeTest.assayLimitations: In samples with viral loads near the limit of detection for the assay, there is low coverage for the region of the viral genome between nucleotide range 700-797. Positive results do not rule out bacterial infection or co-infection with other viruses.
microbeTest.commentsAboutTestInterpretation: Positive results indicate infection by SARS-CoV-2 but correlation with other clinical parameters is necessary. Positive results do not rule out bacterial infection or co-infection with other viruses. The agent detected may not be the definite cause of disease. Negative results do not exclude SARS-CoV-2 infection and patient management should be correlated with other clinical paramters. The sample collection protocol if not properly followed may hamper detection of the test target.
microbeTest.researchPerformedAfterClinicalTestingIsC: Research on novel variants, if detected.

proficiencyTesting.methodDescription: SARS-CoV-2 molecular testing is performed across all assay platforms twice per year.

microbeTest.internalTestValidationMethod: Positive and negative controls are included in each assay run.
